text:
Hello!

Is there a way to get the underlying iterator from Base.Iterators.Take. if know i can do it.xs but this would not work for all iterators listed in Base.Iterators.

elements.text:
Hello!

Is there a way to get the underlying iterator from Base.Iterators.Take. if know i can do it.xs but this would not work for all iterators listed in Base.Iterators.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
No, this is an implementation detail, so there is no API for this

elements.text: No, this is an implementation detail, so there is no API for this

text: I dont understand what you mean. That it is not needed for the iterators protoocol, right ? It is my "job" to define a getIterator(it::Take) for all the iterators in base.iterators? Maybe my pattern is not good then

elements.text: I dont understand what you mean. That it is not needed for the iterators protoocol, right ? It is my "job" to define a getIterator(it::Take) for all the iterators in base.iterators? Maybe my pattern is not good then

text: Why not just iterate the `Take` itself, instead of iterating `Take's` underlying iterator?
what do you want to do with the underlying iterator?
